intro: Psoralea vanberkeliae, commonly known as the Vanberkel's psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense spikes. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Psoralea vanberkeliae is often found in open vegetation types such as grasslands and shrublands.
